explanation:
memset — This is the string.h function under the MISRA rule. Each memset call in the function must be checked: that the pointer argument is a valid pointer to the object being initialized and that the size argument does not exceed the actual object size.

struct pst_dynamic — The local variable psd_data is of this type and sizeof(psd_data) is passed to memset. The definition of this structure (layout and size) is needed to confirm that the &psd_data pointer and sizeof(psd_data) correctly describe the object being written by memset.

pstat_getdynamic — This system API writes into the psd_data buffer. Its prototype and semantics (how many bytes/elements it may write given the size and count arguments) are required to ensure it cannot write beyond psd_data and thereby interact with any subsequent or prior memset usage in a way that would violate the rule.

SYSTEM_INFO — The local variable sysInfo is of this type and sizeof(sysInfo) is passed to memset. The structure definition and member types (in particular dwNumberOfProcessors) are needed to confirm that the &sysInfo pointer and sizeof(sysInfo) correctly describe the object being passed to memset and that casts/assignments involving its members are safe.

GetNativeSystemInfo and GetSystemInfo — These Windows APIs write into the SYSTEM_INFO object provided by the caller. Their prototypes/semantics are required to verify they will not write more bytes than sizeof(SYSTEM_INFO) (i.e., will not overflow the object that was zeroed with memset).
